H0.text: The liver is the organ inflamed in hepatitis B.

H1.text: The colon is the organ that hepatitis B causes inflammation of.

H2.text: The kidney is the organ that Hepatitis B inflames.

H3.text: The brain is the organ that hepatitis B inflames.

A4.text: Hepatitis B is an infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV) that affects the liver; it is a type of viral hepatitis.

A5.text: Hepatitis B virus has been linked to the development of membranous glomerulonephritis (MGN).

A6.text: Chronic (rather than acute) infection with hepatitis B virus or hepatitis C virus is the main cause of liver cancer.
